intro: Ourisia, commonly known as the "buttercup grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and are characterized by their small, delicate flowers and basal leaves. Ourisia species often grow in rocky or sandy soils, preferring well-drained environments. They are known for their early blooming period, often appearing in spring. The genus includes around 50 species, many of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
